intro: Lotononis ambigua, commonly known as the African bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain its seeds. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
